title: Washington-Rochambeau National Historic Trail: New Jersey
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Places To Go     New Jersey              New Jersey - Places To Go           Wick House in Morristown NPS photo  Morristown National Historical Park Just prior to the arrival of French troops in July 1780, the Continental Army encamped at Morristown during the coldest winter on record of the American Revolution.             Old Baracks in Trenton   Old Barracks in Trenton The French Army encamped in Trenton during their march to and from Yorktown.  Sick and wounded soldiers from the siege of Yorktown were most likely the last soldiers to use the Barracks.        More Information For detailed maps and more information about the trail in New Jersey, see the Washington-Rochambeau Revolutionary Route in New Jersey Association and the Crossroads of the American Revolution Heritage Area.
